28.
FORWARD LOOK
Minutes of the Activities Committee: Nominations were held to choose members
of the Activities Committee. This committee would do further planning for the
region and assimilate all suggestions made at this meeting to make studies and
recommendations for improvement.
These nominations were:
Leo Martin, Tony Zaitz, Arthur Weld, Larry Creshkoff and Dorothy Daniel.
The vote was unanimous and these five became the members of the Region I
Activities Committee. Zaitz was chosen as chairman of the Committee.
The committee met Friday evening to consider the problem of the next con¬
ference. Syracuse extended an invitation and it was decided to submit this to the
group in view of expense and distance and to invite suggestions from the floor
of the meeting.
Other problems were discussed and presented to the group. A regional Net¬
work Committee was appointed to study multiplexing or some sort of relay system
for radio and television. Four persons were chosen for this Network Committee:
W. W. Smith, Chairman5 H. M. Gunn, Operations Manager of WGBH-TV; James Bonney,
Chief Engineer, WBUR$ William H. Pitkin, Chief Engineer, WNYC.
The second meeting of the Activities Committee was held Saturday morning.
At this meeting an invitation for the next conference was extended by Pitts¬
burgh. It was decided to announce the Syracuse and Pittsburgh invitations at the
general meeting with final selection of site depending on (l) relative expenses,
as no expenses would be paid for the second meeting, and (2) whether there would
be a national meeting every year or every other year. This latter would relate
to distance and finance. The Committee brought up the point concerning the best
